3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:30): Bert: Can you remove 'valign=baseline' from the propdef tables, please? It's deprecated, use 'vertical-align' :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:30): The CSSWG stylesheet uses background-clip, which is not part of 2.1, so we fail CSS validation according to pubrules. ^_^

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:30): in the validator
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:31): tries to get the HTML to validate, at least
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:31): HTML validation is easy.  Just switch the preprocessor to not output @valign, and use <abbr> instead of <acronym>

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:44): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Fiddling with Images again.  I don't like the way we're preventing nested image().  The way it's written, only a whitelist of <image> types are allowed in the final fallback, which means we'll have to keep it updated.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:45): I'd rather just say "<color> | <image>", and then disallow image() in the prose.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:46): It's also too restrictive - the way you rewrote it, <image-combination> isn't allowed, even if there's no reference to image() in the arguments to cross-fade().
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:50): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: why wouldn't you just cross-fade(image(),image()) in that case?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I see what you mean about updates, let me think on that a bit
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:51): I'm not saying you wouldn't.  I'm saying that as it's written, you can't do an image("foo", cross-fade(url("bar"), blue, 50%)) or something.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): is that useful?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:52): It's not clearly useless, and I don't think there's any simplicity benefits from disallowing it.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:53): I'd ask dbaron on that
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:53): I don't work on the parser/data side
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:54): Well, I'll say that you don't gain anything from disallowing that while allowing, say, nested cross-fade()s.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:54): we allow nested cross-fade()s?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:54): Sure.  An image is an image.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:54): do we have to?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:54): Why wouldn't you?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:54): It lets you fade three images together.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:55): I'd like to get implementer feedback on all this nesting stuff
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): If it's easy, fine
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): if it's extra work, I'd like to keep nesting out of this level
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): it's definitely more complicated to test
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:56): Other than the fact that more image manipulation = more CPU load, there's no problem from doing so.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): It's definitely possible to extend in that direction in the future
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:57): But if we disallow nested cross-fades, you can still, say, filter() a cross-fade(), or vice versa, which is roughly equivalent in difficulty.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:57): so I'm kindof biased towards not allowing nesting
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:57): I'm biased toward not putting in artificial restrictions just because it makes testing more difficult.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:57): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I think you should ask Arron about that. He might disagree
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): doesn't see filter() in this draft
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:58): We'd have to invent a notion of a <plain-image> versus <constructed-image> or something, and only allow some functions to take <plain-image> as arguments.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:58): No, filter() will be in Filters.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): good
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:58): Along with maybe noise(), I dunno.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): I was like, I think we have enough crazy stuff here already!
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:58): noise() won't be in this draft, at least.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:58): Either Filters or Images 4.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:03): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: actually...
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:03): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I think we should also remove <element-reference> from image()
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:04): Really?  Why?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:04): why would you fall back to an element reference?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:04): What do you gain from removing it?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:05): simplicity
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:05): I'm kindof thinking we should remove everything except <image-decl> and <color>
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:05): the last is only there to provide enough contrast in case stuff fails
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:05): That's silly.  Then I can't fall back to a gradient, for example.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:06): you're already in a failure mode if your images don't load
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:06): if you can fall back to a gradient, then why not fall back to a full <background> declaration
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): where you can create whatever image you want with gradients?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): like
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): that's not the point here
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): the only reason <color> is there is to provide adequate contrast
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): in case images are turned of or don't load
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:07): Hm.  Actually, I'd probably be okay with dropping down to that level of simplicity.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): Ok, let's do that.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:08): We can add things back in CSS4 if we find it's really really needed
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:08): I just didn't like the seemingly-artificial distinctions in what types of images were allowed.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:10): k, css3-lists pub request sent
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:11): Thank you!
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:11): Good job with the module!
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:11): It's way more coherent and awesome now :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): But, definitely needs another cycle or two of WD-level review :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): I noticed a bunch of stuff while scanning through it
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:15): Yeah, definitely.  I just think it's feature-complete now, so I'm happy.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:18): yeah
